DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Small Cell Surgical Margin Present Yes No Indeterminate Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether malignant small cell was present at the surgical margin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Small Cell Surgical Margin Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant round or round to fusiform cell with scant amount of cytoplasm, small nucleus, and absent or inconspicuous nucleolus.:One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A malignant round or round to fusiform cell with scant amount of cytoplasm, small nucleus, and absent or inconspicuous nucleolus.

Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)
